header.headertext: SECOND MARSHALLED LIST OF AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED ON REPORT
The amendments have been marshalled in accordance with the Order of 11th February 2014, as follows—
Clause 31 Schedule 16 Clauses 32 and 33 Schedule 17 Clauses 34 to 43 Schedule 18 Clauses 44 and 45 Schedule 19 Clauses 46 to 49 Schedule 20 Clauses 50 to 56
[Amendments marked * are new or have been altered]

text.quote: 23: Clause 33, page 16, line 37, leave out “of which the person is an active member”
23A: Schedule 17, page 96, line 7, leave out lines 7 to 11 and insert “the cash equivalent transfer value of the transferable benefits of a qualifying member of a transferable benefits scheme is—
text.IndentOne: (a) transferred to the automatic transfer scheme, and
(b) used to provide rights for the member under it in accordance with the prescribed transfer rules”

text.quote: 23B: Schedule 17, page 96, line 18, leave out “an active” and insert “a”
23C: Schedule 17, page 97, line 5, leave out paragraph 2 and insert—
text.HeadingTwo: “Transferable benefits scheme to transfer benefits to automatic transfer scheme
text.quote: 2 (1) The regulations must require the transferable benefits scheme to transfer the member’s transferable benefits, and the automatic transfer scheme to allow the transfer, if certain conditions are met.
(2) The regulations may make provision pursuant to either paragraph 3 or 3A for the trustees or managers of the transferable benefits scheme and the automatic transfer scheme to take certain steps—
text.IndentOne: (a) at a particular time (for example, within a prescribed period after an event under the transferable pension rules such as the date on which a member ceases to be an active member of a transferable benefits scheme or at prescribed intervals);
(b) for the steps to be taken at any particular time to relate to a particular qualifying member or to some or all qualifying members;

(c) for the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme or a transferable benefits scheme to notify the trustees or managers of the other scheme that the conditions for automatic transfer have been met; and
(d) to make further provision for the transfer of benefits from the transferable benefits scheme to the automatic transfer scheme.”

text.quote: 23D: Schedule 17, page 97, line 15, leave out “must” and insert “may”
23E: Schedule 17, page 97, line 26, at end insert—
text.HeadingTwo: “Transferable benefits scheme to effect transfer of cash equivalent
text.quote: 3A (1) The regulations may require the trustees or managers of a transferable benefits scheme to enter an agreement with the trustees or managers of an automatic transfer scheme in order to automatically transfer transferable benefits to the automatic transfer scheme if—
text.IndentOne: (a) there are one or more qualifying members in the transferable benefits scheme who are no longer active members; and
(b) any other prescribed conditions are met.
text.quote: (2) The regulations may make provision for a protocol through which a transferable benefits scheme may establish an agreement with an automatic transfer scheme to transfer benefits.

(3) The conditions that may be prescribed because of sub-paragraph (1)(b) include a condition that the trustees or managers must not enter into an agreement to transfer unless the qualifying member consents in accordance with regulations.”
23F: Schedule 17, page 97, line 30, leave out “an automatic transfer” and insert “a transferable benefits”
23G: Schedule 17, page 97, line 39, leave out “an automatic transfer” and insert “a transferable benefits”
23H: Schedule 17, page 97, line 42, after “notice” insert “or entering an agreement”
23J: Schedule 17, page 98, line 10, leave out sub-paragraph (1) and insert—
“(1) The regulations may—
text.IndentOne: (a) require the trustees or managers of a transferable benefits scheme who receive a transfer notice requesting the transfer of the cash equivalent of a person’s transferable benefits in accordance with paragraph 3 above to do what is needed to carry out the request; or

(b) require the trustees or managers of an automatic enrolment scheme who receive a request from the trustees or managers of a transferable benefits scheme to enter a transfer agreement to do what is needed to receive the transfer.”

25: Clause 43, page 24, line 2, leave out “work-based”
26: Clause 43, page 24, line 4, leave out “work-based”
26A*: After Clause 43, insert the following new Clause—
“Disclosure of information about transaction costs to members etc
text.IndentOne: In section 113 of the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (disclosure of information about schemes to members etc), after subsection (4) insert—
text.quote: “(5) The Secretary of State must make regulations under this section requiring information about some or all of the transaction costs of work-based money purchase schemes to be given to some or all of the persons mentioned in subsection (2).
(6) But subsection (5) does not apply in relation to a scheme of a particular description if—
text.IndentOne: (a) as a result of another enactment, requirements are imposed relating to the disclosure of information about transaction costs of schemes of that description, and
(b) in the opinion of the Secretary of State, those requirements provide an adequate alternative to what is required by subsection (5).
text.quote: (7) In this section—
“work-based money purchase scheme” means a money purchase scheme that is—
text.IndentOne: (a) an occupational pension scheme,
(b) a personal pension scheme where direct payment arrangements (within the meaning of section 111A) exist in respect of one or more members of the scheme who are workers, or
(c) a personal pension scheme which is or has been registered under section 2 of the Welfare Reform and Pensions Act 1999 (stakeholder pension schemes);
text.quote: “worker” means a person—
text.IndentOne: (a) who is a worker for the purposes of Part 1 of the Pensions Act 2008, or
(b) to whom a provision of Part 1 of that Act applies as if the person were a worker because of a provision of Chapter 8 of that Part;
but for the purposes of paragraph (b), ignore section 92 of that Act.””

text.quote: 26B*: After Clause 43, leave out lines 5 to 8 and insert—

“(5) The Secretary of State must make regulations under this section requiring information about all of the transaction costs of work-based money purchase schemes to be given both to all of the persons mentioned in subsection (2) and to the Pensions Regulator.
(5A) The Pensions Regulator shall maintain a public register on which all the costs referred to in subsection (5) are separately listed.

(5B) The costs referred to in subsection (5), when aggregated, must be equivalent to the total costs, both explicit and implicit, incurred by or on behalf of the members of the relevant occupational pension scheme or personal pension scheme.”
27: After Clause 43, insert the following new Clause—
“Work-based schemes: requirements for disclosure of charges and other information
text.IndentOne: The Secretary of State shall by regulations make provision to require disclosure at least annually of such management and transaction charges incurred by the administration and management of each investment portfolio managed by or on behalf of a work-based scheme as the Secretary of State determines should be so disclosed.”

text.quote: 28: After Clause 43, insert the following new Clause—
“Work-based schemes: requirements for disclosure of charges and other information (No. 2)

(1) The Secretary of State shall by regulations make provision to require disclosure at least annually of the management and transaction charges incurred by the administration and management of each investment portfolio managed by or on behalf of a work-based scheme.
(2) Regulations made under this section may, inter alia, provide for the disclosure of—
text.IndentOne: (a) fees and performance fees paid to investment managers,
(b) commissions and bid-offer spreads paid to brokers,
(c) bid-offer spreads paid to foreign exchange counterparties,
(d) fees, revenue splits and bid-offer spreads paid to custodian banks,
(e) fees paid to in-house or third party scheme administrators,
(f) fees paid to professional advisors (e.g. actuaries, legal advisers, auditors, investment consultants etc.),
(g) initial charges, bid-offer spreads, exit charges, other fees and rebates charged on investments in pooled funds, and
(h) any other management and transaction charges that the Secretary of State from time to time considers appropriate.”

text.quote: 29: Schedule 18, page 103, line 40, at end insert—
“(1A) The Secretary of State must lay before Parliament regulations to restrict such charges as soon as reasonably practicable and no later than 30th April 2015.”

32: Schedule 20, page 108, line 37, at end insert—

“( ) A person credited with a length of notional pensionable service because of pension credit rights is to be treated for the purposes of this paragraph as having pensionable service of that length (in addition to any pensionable service that the person is treated as having under sub-paragraph (8)).”
33: Schedule 20, page 109, line 6, at end insert—

“(9A) Where a person becomes entitled to relevant compensation in respect of benefits under two or more connected occupational pension schemes at the same time, this paragraph applies in relation to the relevant compensation in respect of each benefit as if—
text.IndentOne: (a) a reference to the length of the person’s pensionable service were a reference to the total length of the person’s pensionable service under all of the schemes (ignoring any period of overlap), and

(b) sub-paragraphs (8) and (9) apply for the purposes of working out the length of the person’s pensionable service in respect of each scheme as if a reference to the admissible rules were to the admissible rules of that scheme.”

text.quote: 34: Schedule 20, page 109, line 6, at end insert—
“(9B) When applying this paragraph in relation to relevant compensation in respect of a benefit, ignore any pensionable service that relates to a benefit that is not from the same source.
(9C) For the purposes of sub-paragraph (9B)—
text.IndentOne: (a) benefits attributable to a person’s pensionable service under a scheme are from the same source as benefits attributable to the person’s pensionable service under that or a connected occupational pension scheme,

(b) benefits under a scheme which are attributable to a pension credit from a transferor are from the same source as benefits under that or a connected occupational pension scheme which are attributable to a pension credit from the same transferor, and
(c) benefits are not otherwise from the same source.”

“( ) In paragraph 24(2), at the end insert “of the periodic compensation at that time”.”

37: Schedule 20, page 111, line 37, leave out “sections 127(2)(a) and 128(2)(a) of the Pensions Act 2004” and insert “the following”

text.IndentOne: (a) any provision in which the definition of “protected liabilities” in section 131 of that Act applies, and

text.quote: 39: Schedule 20, page 113, line 3, at end insert—
(1) In relation to a case involving multiple benefits, transitional provision made by order under section 55(8) may, in particular—
text.IndentOne: (a) disapply or modify any provision of this Schedule;
(b) make provision similar to any provision of this Schedule.
text.quote: (2) For these purposes, “a case involving multiple benefits” means a case mentioned in paragraph 26(9) of Schedule 7 to the Pensions Act 2004.”
40: Schedule 20, page 113, line 3, at end insert—

(1) Transitional provision made by order under section 55(8) may, in particular, make provision in relation to compensation payable under Chapter 1 of Part 3 of the Pensions Act 2008 (compensation sharing on divorce etc) that is similar to any provision of Part 3 of this Schedule.

(2) Regulations under paragraph 18 of Schedule 5 to the Pensions Act 2008 which restrict an amount payable to a person in any period by reference to a modified version of the compensation cap in paragraph 26A of Schedule 7 to the Pensions Act 2004 (inserted by Part 1 of this Schedule) may also make provision similar to any provision of Part 3 of this Schedule.”
41: Clause 50, page 27, line 16, at end insert—

“(8) Regulations under paragraph 26(9) of Schedule 7 to the Pensions Act 2004 (modifications for cases where compensation becomes payable on different occasions) made in consequence of this section may be made with retrospective effect.”
41A: After Clause 51, insert the following new Clause—
“Review of provisions
text.IndentOne: Within one year from the date of enactment, the Secretary of State shall, following the completion of a public consultation, lay before both Houses of Parliament a report assessing the impact of the provisions contained within this Bill on the following—
(a) current and future recipients of the state pension;
(b) members of private pension schemes;
(c) women born between 6 April 1951 and 5 April 1953;
(d) the level of knowledge among young people of state pension entitlement and private pension provision; and
(e) such other matters that the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions and the House of Commons Work and Pensions Committee deem relevant.”
